snippet: A Russian and a Norwegian are battling in a contest that is once again taking place during escalating tensions among Russia, the United States and Western Europe....
abstract: Cold War battle is playing out at World Chess Championship in Manhattan as defending champion and Norwegian Magnus Carlsen faces off against Russian Sergey Karjakin; contest comes at time of escalating tensions among Russia, United States and Western Europe; Karjakin is vocal supporter of Russian Pres Vladimir Putin and his annexation of Crimea.

byline.contributor: Henrik Pryser Libell and Ivan Nechepurenko contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: A Russian and a Norwegian are battling in a contest that is once again taking place during escalating tensions among Russia, the United States and Western Europe.

headline.main: At World Chess Championship, Familiar Overtones of East-West Politics
headline.print_headline: New Rock Stars of Chess Riff, With a Whiff of Cold War Intrigue
